definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to be sentimentally attached to sb or sth
the ancient Silk Road/see also 絲綢之路|丝绸之路[Si1 chou2 zhi1 Lu4]

sentences.english: She went to the party in her silk dress and pumps.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着綢的連衫裙和淺口輕便鞋參加宴會。

sentences.english: With time and patience the mulberry leaf becomes a silk gown。
sentences.chinese: 只要有時間和耐心，桑樹葉子會變成綢大褂。

sentences.english: Conceptions and methods concerning the research and design of the style and features of figured velvet are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文章介紹了花絨綢風格特徵的研究構思和設計方法。

sentences.english: We should like to purchase Shanghai printed pure silk fabrics.
sentences.chinese: 我們想買些上海出產的真絲印花綢。

sentences.english: The woman put forward a red silk as well as a blue one for our inspection.
sentences.chinese: 這個婦女拿出一條紅絲綢和一條藍絲綢給我們檢查。

sentences.english: The honor attendants wore street - length dresses of lavender Shantung.
sentences.chinese: 出席的貴賓們都穿着不很長的淡紫色山東綢的衣服。

sentences.english: This dress is made of silk, isn' it?
sentences.chinese: 這件衣服是綢做的，對不對？

sentences.english: Thank you for your enquiry of 5 May concerning silk blouses.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝5月5月日來函查詢關於紆綢罩衫的事宜。

sentences.english: She went to the party in her silk dress and pumps .
sentences.chinese: 她穿著綢的連衫裙和淺口輕便鞋參加宴會。

sentences.english: She changed into loose slacks and a sleeveless silk blouse.
sentences.chinese: 她換上寬鬆的長褲和一件無袖綢上衣。

definition: cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
